qa_pairs.question: What is the real name of Gollum before he finds the One Ring?
qa_pairs.answer: Gollum's real name is Sméagol.

qa_pairs.question: What High King of the Noldor was slain by Morgoth during the Kinslaying at Alqualondë?
qa_pairs.answer: Fëanor was slain during the first Kinslaying at Alqualondë.

qa_pairs.question: After Bilbo wins the riddle contest, what word does Gollum say that inadvertently gives Bilbo his last riddle?
qa_pairs.answer: Gollum mutters 'What has it got in its pocketses?' which Bilbo uses as a riddle.

qa_pairs.question: What is the name of the sword that Beren uses to cut a Silmaril from Morgoth’s crown?
qa_pairs.answer: Beren uses Angrist to cut a Silmaril from Morgoth’s crown.

qa_pairs.question: Which Maia disguised himself as Sauron's ally but was actually responsible for much of Sauron's corruption?
qa_pairs.answer: Melkor, known as Morgoth, is the Vala responsible for Sauron's corruption. (No other Maia was responsible in this sense.)

qa_pairs.question: Who was the only dwarf to willingly visit Bilbo Baggins alone before the Unexpected Party?
qa_pairs.answer: Dwalin was the first dwarf to arrive at Bag End and came alone.

qa_pairs.question: What is the secret entry password to the Lonely Mountain that appears under the moon letters?
qa_pairs.answer: 'Stand by the grey stone when the thrush knocks, and the setting sun with the last light of Durin’s Day will shine upon the key-hole.'

qa_pairs.question: Which of the Great Rings were given to the Dwarf-Lords, and why did they fail to corrupt the dwarves?
qa_pairs.answer: Seven rings were given to the Dwarf-lords, but dwarves proved resistant to domination and corruption, although their greed was increased.

qa_pairs.question: Who is Lúthien’s father?
qa_pairs.answer: Thingol, King of Doriath, is Lúthien’s father.

qa_pairs.question: Who is the Lord of the Eagles who rescues Bilbo and the dwarves from the Wargs?
qa_pairs.answer: The Lord of the Eagles is called the Great Eagle (Gwaihir in The Lord of the Rings, but in The Hobbit it is left unnamed).

qa_pairs.question: What is the name of the healing plant also known as Kingsfoil?
qa_pairs.answer: Athelas is also called Kingsfoil.

qa_pairs.question: What riddle does Bilbo fail to answer correctly, but Gollum fails to guess as well?
qa_pairs.answer: 'Time' is the answer to Bilbo’s riddle: 'This thing all things devours...'

qa_pairs.question: What are the names of the two lamps blown out by Melkor and Ungoliant?
qa_pairs.answer: Illuin and Ormal are the Two Lamps.

qa_pairs.question: What was the name of Elrond’s brother, who is ancestor of Númenor’s kings?
qa_pairs.answer: Elrond’s brother was Elros.

qa_pairs.question: Which two towers are referred to in the 'The Two Towers' title?
qa_pairs.answer: Orthanc (Isengard) and Barad-dûr (Mordor), though Tolkien said it could also refer to Minas Morgul.

qa_pairs.question: What is Bard the Bowman's ancestry traced to?
qa_pairs.answer: Bard is a descendant of Girion, Lord of Dale.

qa_pairs.question: Which Vala created the Dwarves?
qa_pairs.answer: Aulë created the Dwarves.

qa_pairs.question: What is the ancient name for Mount Doom?
qa_pairs.answer: Orodruin is the ancient Elvish name for Mount Doom.

qa_pairs.question: Who is the daughter of Thingol and Melian?
qa_pairs.answer: Lúthien is their daughter.

qa_pairs.question: In what valley was Gondolin hidden?
qa_pairs.answer: Gondolin was hidden in the Vale of Tumladen.

qa_pairs.question: What was the original name of Sauron?
qa_pairs.answer: Sauron's original name was Mairon.

qa_pairs.question: What special gift does Galadriel give to Legolas?
qa_pairs.answer: Galadriel gives Legolas a bow of the Galadhrim and a quiver of arrows.

qa_pairs.question: What is the name of the sword found in the troll-cave by Gandalf and later given to Thorin?
qa_pairs.answer: The sword Orcrist.

qa_pairs.question: What does the black arrow symbolize to Bard in The Hobbit?
qa_pairs.answer: The black arrow is a family heirloom, which Bard uses for his final shot at Smaug.

qa_pairs.question: Name the three Silmarils.
qa_pairs.answer: The Silmarils are not individually named; they are simply called the three Silmarils.

qa_pairs.question: Who is killed by being thrown from Orthanc onto spike-ridden machinery in the movie version, but not in the books?
qa_pairs.answer: Saruman is killed in this manner in the Extended Edition of the Return of the King film.

qa_pairs.question: By what name is Gandalf known to the Elves of Lothlórien?
qa_pairs.answer: The Elves of Lothlórien call Gandalf 'Mithrandir.'

qa_pairs.question: Whose death ultimately leads to the breaking of the Siege of Gondor in The Return of the King?
qa_pairs.answer: The death of the Witch-king leads to the breaking of the siege.

qa_pairs.question: What is the true nature of Tom Bombadil, according to Tolkien?
qa_pairs.answer: Tolkien never definitively explains Tom Bombadil’s nature; he is described as 'the spirit of the (vanishing) Oxford and Berkshire countryside.'

qa_pairs.question: What name did Faramir give to the secret entrance into Mordor which he tells Frodo and Sam to avoid?
qa_pairs.answer: The pass of Cirith Ungol.

qa_pairs.question: What are the Arkenstone’s alternative names in The Hobbit?
qa_pairs.answer: It is called the 'Arkenstone of Thrain' or the 'Heart of the Mountain.'

qa_pairs.question: Who is the father of Théoden?
qa_pairs.answer: Thengel is the father of Théoden.

qa_pairs.question: What was the star shape on the door of Moria made out of?
qa_pairs.answer: A star made of ithildin (Mithril + Elvish craft) which only appears by moonlight and starlight.

qa_pairs.question: Who is credited with the composition of 'A Elbereth Gilthoniel'?
qa_pairs.answer: The hymn to Elbereth is sung by the High Elves and written by them, most likely by Gildor and his company.

qa_pairs.question: What was Smaug described as weak in?
qa_pairs.answer: Smaug has a bare patch on his left breast, unprotected by scales.

qa_pairs.question: What is the true identity of Glorfindel in The Lord of the Rings, and what is significant about him?
qa_pairs.answer: Glorfindel is a reborn Elf who died in the First Age slaying a Balrog and returned from Valinor; he is explicitly connected to the same Glorfindel in The Silmarillion.

qa_pairs.question: What two things must be spoken at the door of Moria to open it?
qa_pairs.answer: The password 'Mellon,' which means 'friend,' when spoken in Elvish.

qa_pairs.question: What is the location of Angband?
qa_pairs.answer: Angband was in the northwestern region of Middle-earth, beneath the Thangorodrim mountains.

qa_pairs.question: Who is the mother of Elrond?
qa_pairs.answer: Elwing is Elrond’s mother.

qa_pairs.question: What was the race of Beorn in 'The Hobbit'?
qa_pairs.answer: Beorn is a skin-changer who can transform into a bear.

qa_pairs.question: According to The Silmarillion, which Vala can never speak nor smile?
qa_pairs.answer: Mandos (Námo) is silent and never laughs.

qa_pairs.question: Who is Fingon’s cousin that betrays the Elves to Morgoth?
qa_pairs.answer: Maeglin betrays the city of Gondolin to Morgoth.

qa_pairs.question: Which sword did Elendil wield against Sauron and what became of it?
qa_pairs.answer: Elendil wielded Narsil, which was broken during the battle but the shards were kept and later reforged as Andúril.

qa_pairs.question: What is the full name and lineage of Aragorn as given in the ancient tongue?
qa_pairs.answer: Aragorn, son of Arathorn, is called Elessar, descended from Elendil of Númenor, of the line of Isildur.

qa_pairs.question: What is the meaning of the Elvish phrase 'Aiya Eärendil elenion ancalima'?
qa_pairs.answer: It means 'Hail Eärendil, brightest of stars!'

qa_pairs.question: Who were the three greatest Elf-friends among Men during the First Age, as recognized by the Elves?
qa_pairs.answer: Bëor, Hador, and Haleth, the ancestors of the Three Houses of the Edain.

qa_pairs.question: In what way did the Entwives differ from the Ents, and what was their fate?
qa_pairs.answer: The Entwives preferred cultivating fields and gardens, unlike the forest-loving Ents; they later disappeared after their gardens were destroyed by Sauron.

qa_pairs.question: Which Silmaril ended up in the sky, and how did it get there?
qa_pairs.answer: Eärendil sailed with a Silmaril upon his brow, and it was set as a star in the sky.

qa_pairs.question: Who was Thorin Oakenshield’s father and where did he die?
qa_pairs.answer: Thrain II, who died in Dol Guldur as a prisoner of Sauron.

qa_pairs.question: What is the name of the ring that Galadriel possesses?
qa_pairs.answer: Nenya, the Ring of Water.

qa_pairs.question: Which Maia was the dark lord Morgoth’s most loyal servant?
qa_pairs.answer: Sauron was Morgoth’s most loyal Maia servant.

qa_pairs.question: What is the significance of Lúthien Tinúviel’s mortal descendant to the story of The Lord of the Rings?
qa_pairs.answer: Arwen Undómiel is Lúthien’s descendant, and she marries Aragorn, fulfilling the motif of Elf and mortal union.

qa_pairs.question: Who was Gothmog in the First Age?
qa_pairs.answer: Gothmog was the Lord of Balrogs and the High Captain of Angband.

qa_pairs.question: Which Hobbit first saw the Nazgûl in The Shire?
qa_pairs.answer: Samwise Gamgee saw one of the Nazgûl snooping near Bagshot Row.

qa_pairs.question: What oath did Fëanor and his sons swear, and what were its long-term consequences?
qa_pairs.answer: They swore to retrieve the Silmarils at any cost, leading to centuries of bloodshed, betrayal, and tragedy.

qa_pairs.question: What was the original location of Dol Guldur and who occupied it?
qa_pairs.answer: Dol Guldur stands on Amon Lanc in southern Mirkwood, and Sauron as 'the Necromancer' occupied it.

qa_pairs.question: Who was Turin Turambar, and what doom did he bring about?
qa_pairs.answer: Turin, son of Hurin, was cursed by Morgoth and unknowingly caused the deaths of his closest kin, including his wife Nienor.

qa_pairs.question: Name the parent of the Balrogs according to Tolkien’s mythology.
qa_pairs.answer: Balrogs are corrupted Maiar who followed Morgoth.

qa_pairs.question: Who successfully wielded a Silmaril and survived its light?
qa_pairs.answer: Lúthien and Beren, as well as Eärendil, handled a Silmaril; the latter sailed with it to Valinor.

qa_pairs.question: Which heirloom was claimed as proof of kingship by Aragorn?
qa_pairs.answer: The ring of Barahir and the sword Andúril were symbols of his lineage, but specifically the sword was used for kingship in Gondor.

qa_pairs.question: What was the fate of Maglor, the last surviving son of Fëanor?
qa_pairs.answer: After casting his Silmaril into the sea, he wandered by the shores of Middle-earth, singing laments.

qa_pairs.question: Which Vala was responsible for the sun and the moon?
qa_pairs.answer: Arien guided the sun and Tilion the moon, both under the lordship of Varda.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Sindarin name for the One Ring?
qa_pairs.answer: It was called 'Isilbor' (though not commonly used, the books sometimes refer to it as 'Gorthaur’s Ring' or 'the Master Ring').

qa_pairs.question: Who led the faithful Númenóreans to Middle-earth after the Downfall?
qa_pairs.answer: Elendil led the Faithful (the Elendili) to Middle-earth.

qa_pairs.question: Who was the last High King of the Noldor in Middle-earth?
qa_pairs.answer: Gil-galad was the last High King of the Noldor.

qa_pairs.question: How did Isildur lose the One Ring?
qa_pairs.answer: He was ambushed at the Disaster of the Gladden Fields, and the Ring betrayed him as he tried to escape by slipping from his finger.

qa_pairs.question: What was the legendary homeland of the elves that they left to come to Middle-earth?
qa_pairs.answer: Valinor in Aman.

qa_pairs.question: Who was the mother of Kili and Fili in 'The Hobbit'?
qa_pairs.answer: Dís was their mother.

qa_pairs.question: What was the name of the sword that killed the Witch-king of Angmar?
qa_pairs.answer: Merry used a Barrow-blade forged in Arnor to break the Witch-king’s spell, then Éowyn killed him with her own sword.

qa_pairs.question: Who gave up her immortality to wed a mortal man, other than Lúthien?
qa_pairs.answer: Arwen gave up her immortality for Aragorn in the Third Age.

qa_pairs.question: How many times did Gollum recover the One Ring after initially losing it?
qa_pairs.answer: Gollum never recovered it after Bilbo took it.

qa_pairs.question: In what language is the inscription on the Doors of Durin written?
qa_pairs.answer: It is in Sindarin, written with Tengwar script.

qa_pairs.question: Who is called 'the Mouth of Sauron' and what is his origin?
qa_pairs.answer: The Mouth of Sauron was a Black Númenórean and Sauron’s chief envoy.

qa_pairs.question: What makes Frodo’s mithril shirt so special?
qa_pairs.answer: It is made from mithril, light as a feather and stronger than steel, and was originally made for an Elven prince.

qa_pairs.question: Which Elven king was slain by a Balrog during the fall of Gondolin?
qa_pairs.answer: King Ecthelion of the Fountain slew Gothmog but also died in the process.

qa_pairs.question: What was the relationship between Galadriel and Fëanor?
qa_pairs.answer: Galadriel was Fëanor’s niece (her father Finarfin was Fëanor's half-brother).

qa_pairs.question: Where did Thorin Oakenshield die?
qa_pairs.answer: Thorin died from wounds sustained during the Battle of Five Armies at the foot of the Lonely Mountain.

qa_pairs.question: Which Ent witnessed the creation of the Sun and Moon?
qa_pairs.answer: Fangorn (Treebeard) claims to be one of the oldest living beings and remembers the ‘darkness under the stars’ before the Sun and Moon.

qa_pairs.question: Who constructed the first dwelling of Men in Beleriand?
qa_pairs.answer: The people of Bëor constructed the first dwelling, Estolad.

qa_pairs.question: What object did Arvedui, last king of Arthedain, lose in the Icebay of Forochel?
qa_pairs.answer: He lost the palantír of Annúminas and Amon Sûl (‘the Seeing Stones’).

qa_pairs.question: Who defeated and killed Carcharoth, the great wolf?
qa_pairs.answer: Huan the Hound and Beren together killed Carcharoth.

qa_pairs.question: What is the Elvish name for Rivendell?
qa_pairs.answer: Imladris is the Elvish name for Rivendell.
